cellularAutomata.artificialLife.data
Class Files

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.artificialLife.data.Files

public class Files
extends java.lang.Object

Allows easy read/write interactions with files.

This is very old code, that needs rewriting. The getLine method is very slow and needs improvement.

Author:
David Bahr

public Files(java.lang.String filename)
      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
             java.io.IOException
Creates the file if it does not already exist.

Parameters:
filename - The path to the file.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - If cannot find file.
java.io.IOException - If cannot read file.
Method Detail

append

public void append(java.util.Collection data)
Appends a collection to the end of the file by iterating over each element and then applying toString with a new line character added at the end. Remember that an ArrayList, Vector, Hashset, and others are all Collections.

Parameters:
data - The collection of data.

append

public void append(java.lang.String data)
Appends a string to the end of the file. Does not add a new line character.

Parameters:
data - The string data.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if cannot write to the file.

appendLine

public void appendLine(java.lang.String line)
Appends a new line to the end of the file and adds a new line character.

Parameters:
line - The new line.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if cannot write to the file.

emptyFile

public void emptyFile()
Removes all data from the file.

getLine

public java.lang.String getLine(int lineNumber)
Gets a specific line from the file (ridiculously slow!). An expensive operation! This method could be improved.

Parameters:
lineNumber - The line of the file (between 0 and number of lines in file minus one).
Returns:
The line as a string. Returns string "EOF" if past the end of the file. Returns empty string if before beginning of the file.

getNewLineCharacters

public java.lang.String getNewLineCharacters()
Returns the characters necessary to create a new line.

Returns:
newline characters.

numberOfLines

public int numberOfLines()
Finds number of lines in the file.

Returns:
number of lines in the file.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Convert the file to a String.
